Comment: I graduated in 2013, they were not allowed at that time, and they didn't appear to be budging on the rule at all. This change has probably occurred over the last 6 or 7 years. This is the parents' fault. Parents feel like they deserve the right to communicate with their children at any moment during the school day, and there is an argument that they are right. My opinion is that the negatives of kids having phones at school outweigh the positives. High schoolers need to learn to be independent from their parents and communicate with those around them, developing real social skills. Kids are drinking less, smoking less, and partying less than they have in the last 80 years, but they are also more depressed than they ever have been. The days of forming core memories during those crucial years of your life are over for the majority of kids.
